Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game2.Animal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Animal
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    Dwegrzyn A class representing the animals that appear in the Crab Catcher game
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal(int xloc,
              int yloc,
              java.lang.String typeOfAnimal,
              int scoreEffect,
              double displayDuration,
              boolean visible)
        Parameters:
        xloc - the x coordinate of the animal
        yloc - the y coordinate of the animal
        typeOfAnimal - the type of animal ( "crab", "mittencrab", or "fish")
        scoreEffect - the integer to be added to the score if this animal is caught (can be negative)
        displayDuration - how long the animal should stay on screen
        visible - is true if the animal is visible

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public Animal copy()
        Returns:
        a copy of the animal that shares the major values: [location, type, scoreEffect, displayDuration, visibility, image]

      • deserialize

        public static java.lang.Object deserialize(java.lang.String fileName)
        Method to read and instantiate animal from file. The reverse of the serialize function
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        Returns:
        loaded animal object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • regenerateAnimal

        public void regenerateAnimal(int xbound,
                             int ybound)
        Call this method to regenerate animal after it is caught or time on screen expires makes the animal invisible, resets its timeLeftOnScreen, and sets offscreen location randomly
        Parameters:
        xbound - max x location
        ybound - max y location

      • onTick

        public void onTick(CrabCatcherGame game)
